member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.Trevista.CogTrevistaTool.LastRunRecordDiagEnable
member.summary: Enable the creation of graphical tool records by bitwise ORing the desired values from .
member.value: A bitwise combination of the values from . Default value is InputImageByReference.

remarks.para: A VisionPro tool record is a data structure that contains graphical information about the state of the tool. You can obtain two different records from the tool: the Current Record, which describes the current state of the tool, and the LastRun Record, which describes the state of the tool immediately after the last call to the tool's Run function.
The current record is obtained by calling the method of the tool. The last run record is obtained by calling the method.

You can specify the content of the current record using the property. You can specify the content of the last run record using the
and properties. Graphical information requested via the property is only created when the tool is run, and may cause the tool to run more slowly.

member.event: Fires when this property changes. The following state flag may be affected:

The current record is obtained by calling the method of the tool. The last run record is obtained by calling the method.

You can specify the content of the current record using the property. You can specify the content of the last run record using the

member.name: T:Cognex.VisionPro.Trevista.CogTrevistaTool
member.summary:
Class that represents the top-level Trevista tool. With this tool you can process an input
and create a
with up to nine output images. You can select which output images you want using the RunParams that are part of the tool. The class holds all of the objects needed to process the input, display graphic records, and hold the results.

member.name: M:Cognex.VisionPro.Trevista.CogTrevista.CreateFloatHistogram(Cognex.VisionPro.Trevista.CogTrevistaOutputImageConstants,System.Int32,System.Double@,System.Double@,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates a histogram of the internal floating point values for the image that you specify.
member.returns: A one-dimensional of integers that contains the requested histogram. Or null, if the histogram cannot be computed.
member.param: An enumeration that specifies which image will be histogrammed.
The number of elements to create in the returned histogram array.

If is false, this output is the minimum floating point value found in the histogrammed image. If is true, this output is the smaller of:
The minimum floating point value found in the histogrammed image,
The for the histogrammed image.
The for the histogrammed image.
This output will be zero if the histogram cannot be computed.

If is false, this output is the maximum floating point value found in the histogrammed image. If is true, this output is the larger of:
The maximum floating point value found in the histogrammed image,
The for the histogrammed image.
The for the histogrammed image.
This output will be zero if the histogram cannot be computed.

If true, the floating point range of the output histogram will be expanded (if necessary) to include both the and
values. If false, the floating point range of the output histogram will exactly match the range of values in the histogrammed image.
member.exception: If the object has been disposed.

The supplied argument is not a valid member of the
enumeration.
The supplied argument is less than one.

remarks.para: The returned histogram represents the range of floating point numbers between and , broken into bins. The integer value in each bin is the number of image pixels whose value falls into that bin's portion of the full range. If is true, there may be zero-valued bins at either end of the returned histogram array.
The returned histogram is computed based on the results of the last call to . If the specified image has never been computed, a null histogram will be returned, and and will be set to zero.

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.Trevista.CogTrevista.MotionAccuracy
member.summary: Cognex Internal Use Only. Gets or sets the motion compensation accuracy.
member.value:
The motion compensation accuracy. Must be greater than zero and less than or equal to one. The accuracy of motion compensation increases as this value approaches 1. Default value is 1. This property is ignored if
is None.
member.event: Fires when this property changes. The following state flag may be affected:
member.exception: If the object has been disposed.
The supplied value is either greater than 1, or less than or equal to zero.

remarks.para: This property only supports float value type precision. Up to five decimal places (such as 0.00001) will be maintained. Further precision can be assigned but will be lost due truncation.

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.Trevista.CogTrevista.MotionFilterSize
member.summary: Cognex Internal Use Only. Gets or sets the filter size of the matching algorithm, in pixels, to be used when including motion compensation in the processing of output images.
member.value:
The filter size of the matching algorithm, in pixels, to be used when processing must compensate for relative motion that occurred between acquisition of each of the four input shading images. Default value is 71. This property is ignored if
is None.
member.remarks: Motion compensation tries to match a portion of one shading image to another, and then estimates the linear motion between those two consecutive shading images. The MotionFilterSize property specifies the size of the "portion" that can be matched between two shading images. Larger values make compensation run more slowly, but increase accuracy.
member.event: Fires when this property changes. The following state flag may be affected:
member.exception: If the object has been disposed.

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.Trevista.CogTrevista.MotionType
member.summary: Cognex Internal Use Only. Gets or sets what type of motion compensation will be included in the processing of output images.
member.value:
How processing of output images will compensate for relative motion that occurred between acquisition of each of the four input shading images. Options include:
Default value is None.
member.remarks:
Motion copmensation is only relevant for
images. It has no effect, and no reasonable interpretation, for
images.
member.event: Fires when this property changes. The following state flag may be affected:
member.exception: If the object has been disposed.

The supplied value is not a valid member of the
enumeration.

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.Trevista.CogTrevista.SensorCorrectionEnabled
member.summary:
Gets or sets whether gradient correction is performed as part of the calculation of
and
member.value:
If true, include gradient correction to compute a more accurate
and . If false, skip gradient correction in order to compute results in less time. Default value is false.
member.event: Fires when this property changes. The following state flag may be affected:
member.exception: If the object has been disposed.

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.Trevista.CogTrevista.IsGpuAvailable
member.summary: Returns true if a supported GPU is currently available.

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.Trevista.CogTrevista.GPUDeviceIndex
member.summary: Cognex Internal Use Only Gets or sets the GPU device to use when ProcessorType is set to GpuIfAvailable
member.value: The Default value is 0 Value can not be less than 0
member.remarks: If selected GPUDeviceIndex is greater than the number of available GPUs, then the max index of the available GPUs will be used instead.
member.event: Fires when this property changes. The following state flag may be affected:
member.exception: If the object has been disposed.
The supplied value is less than zero.

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.Trevista.CogTrevista.CpuProcessingThreadCountMax
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of threads to use when processing with a CPU
member.value: The Default value is 4 If set to zero, the number of threads used will be one less than the number of concurrent threads supported by this implementation.
member.remarks: A value of 0 means one less than the number of threads that can be executed simultaneously. There is no restriction on max value, but keep in mind that more threads does not always mean faster processing. At some point it will even slow down the processing speed.
member.event: Fires when this property changes. The following state flag may be affected:
member.exception: If the object has been disposed.
The supplied value is less than zero.

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.Trevista.CogTrevista.ProcessorType
member.summary: Gets or sets the preferred mechanism for the processing of results.
member.value:
The preferred processing mechanism. Options include:
Always compute results using a CPU.
Compute results using a supported GPU if available, otherwise use a CPU.
Default value is CpuOnly.
member.event: Fires when this property changes. The following state flag may be affected:

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.Trevista.CogTrevista.SensorCompensationModifier
member.summary: Gets or sets the modifier to apply to sensor correction in order to account for distortion from reflectance, sensor position, or other factors (no units, see remarks for details).
member.value: The compensation modifier to apply to the images during processing. Default value is 0.
member.event: Fires when this property changes. The following state flag may be affected:
member.exception: If the object has been disposed.

remarks.para:
This property is only applied if the
property is set to True.
This property only supports float value type precision. Up to five decimal places (such as 0.00001) will be maintained. Further precision can be assigned but will be lost due truncation.
This property applies to all output images other than the Shading and Greyscale images. Eg. the gradient images and all images derived from those images.

The Sensor Compensation Modifier is an abstracted, relative, value intended for handling scenarios where adjustment is required in the processed images to account for factors such as sensor position or reflectance that are atypical and consequently producing distortion in those images. This value may be positive or negative within a range of -1 to 1.

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.Trevista.CogTrevista.SensorPixelSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the SensorPixelSize in millimeters.
member.value: The distance in millimeters that corresponds to the width or height of one pixel in the input image. Default value is 0.05.
member.event: Fires when this property changes. The following state flag may be affected:
member.exception: If the object has been disposed.

remarks.para:
This property is only applied if the
property is set to True.
This property only supports float value type precision. Up to five decimal places (such as 0.00001) will be maintained. Further precision can be assigned but will be lost due truncation.

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.Trevista.CogTrevista.DomeDiameter
member.summary: Gets or sets the diameter of the dome illumination unit in millimeters.
member.value: Diameter of the dome illumination unit in millimeters. Default value is 300.
member.event: Fires when this property changes. The following state flag may be affected:
member.exception: If the object has been disposed.
The supplied value is less than or equal to zero.

remarks.para:
The nominal diameter values for the three Trevista domes are listed below. You should enter the value that matches your dome hardware.
Small dome: 120 mm
Medium dome: 300 mm
Large dome: 580 mm

This property is only applied if the
property is set to True.
This property only supports float value type precision. Up to five decimal places (such as 0.00001) will be maintained. Further precision can be assigned but will be lost due truncation.

member.name: T:Cognex.VisionPro.Trevista.CogTrevista
member.summary:
Class that holds the Trevista run parameters. These parameters are used by the
method and control how the Trevista algorithm will generate the output images.
member.remarks:
The CogTrevista class processes an input that shows four uniquely illuminated views of a surface to be analyzed. From that input, the
method produces a set of output images that emphasize specific aspects of the surface.

summary.para: Gets the computed depth image for this result.
The concrete type of this property will be either or as requested at run time.
This property will be null if this output image was not requested.

remarks.para: The comes in two varieties: "local" and "global".
When the is , the is computed by effectively integrating the twice to get the surface height. Use Local mode to compute the relative heights of surface areas that lie near each other in your image.

When the is , the is computed by effectively integrating the and the to get the surface height. Use Global mode to compute the relative heights of surface areas that lie far away from each other in your image.

Flat areas of your 3D surface will have a value of zero in the floating point ContourImage, but may have a non-zero floating point value in the ShapeHorizontal and ShapeVertical images. This means that Global mode is a better choice for surfaces that have large, flat areas that are not perpendicular to the optical axis of your lens.

summary.para: Gets the computed contour image for this result.
The concrete type of this property will be either or as requested at run time.
This property will be null if this output image was not requested.

remarks.para: This image is the second derivative of the surface.
The internal floating point representation of this image has both positive and negative pixel values, where contour "peaks" have a positive value and contour "valleys" have a negative value.
For default values of and , such peaks will be brighter and valleys will be darker.

summary.para: Gets the computed greyscale image for this result.
The concrete type of this property will be either or as requested at run time.
This property will be null if this output image was not requested.

remarks.para: This image is the arithmetic average of the four input shading images.
The internal floating point representation of this image has only positive values.

summary.para: Gets the computed ShapeVerticalImage for this result.
The concrete type of this property will be either or as requested at run time.
This property will be null if this output image was not requested.

remarks.para: This image is the surface slope, or Y gradient, along a vertical axis that increases from bottom to top.
The internal floating point representation of this image has both positive and negative pixel values.

summary.para: Gets the computed ShapeHorizontalImage for this result.
The concrete type of this property will be either or as requested at run time.
This property will be null if this output image was not requested.

remarks.para: This image is the surface slope, or X gradient, along a horizontal axis that increases from left to right.
The internal floating point representation of this image has both positive and negative pixel values.

summary.para: Gets the fourth input shading image for this result.
This image has been "unpacked" from the single input .
The concrete type of this property will be either or as requested at run time.
This property will be null if this output image was not requested.

remarks.para:
If the input image's
was
then this shading image was illuminated from the "south east" or lower right quadrant of the image.

If the input image's
was
then this shading image was illuminated from the "south" or bottom half of the image.
The internal floating point representation of this image has only positive values.

summary.para: Gets the third input shading image for this result.
This image has been "unpacked" from the single input .
The concrete type of this property will be either or as requested at run time.
This property will be null if this output image was not requested.

remarks.para:
If the input image's
was
then this shading image was illuminated from the "south west" or lower left quadrant of the image.

If the input image's
was
then this shading image was illuminated from the "west" or left half of the image.
The internal floating point representation of this image has only positive values.

This image has been "unpacked" from the single input .
The concrete type of this property will be either or as requested at run time.
This property will be null if this output image was not requested.

remarks.para:
If the input image's
was
then this shading image was illuminated from the "north west" or upper left quadrant of the image.

If the input image's
was
then this shading image was illuminated from the "north" or top half of the image.
The internal floating point representation of this image has only positive values.

summary.para: Gets the first input shading image for this result.
This image has been "unpacked" from the single input .
The concrete type of this property will be either or as requested at run time.
This property will be null if this output image was not requested.

If the input image's
was
then this shading image was illuminated from the "north east" or upper right quadrant of the image.

If the input image's

then this shading image was illuminated from the "east" or right half of the image.
The internal floating point representation of this image has only positive values.

member.name: T:Cognex.VisionPro.Trevista.CogTrevistaResult
member.summary: This class holds a single Trevista result. This result consists of up to nine separate images. Only images that were enabled by the RunParams are included in the result. The type of these images will be either or , as specified in the RunParams. The result properties corresponding to images that were not requested will be null.

The standard StreamingContext argument.

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.Trevista.CogTrevistaDepthImageParams.DepthLevel
member.summary: Gets or sets the depth calculation level.
member.value: Depth calculation level. Larger values expand the region that affects a computed depth value. Default value is 20.

remarks.para:
If you are using
depth mode, you should set the depth level to a number that is approximately the size (in pixels) of the entire surface over which you wish to compute the depth.

If you are using
depth mode, you should set the depth level to a number that is bigger than the size (in pixels) of the local surface patch over which you wish to compute the depth. Notice that the depth computation in
mode will become slower as you increase the DepthLevel.

A depth level of 0 is valid and has a unique behavior when in
depth mode. In this case, the depth level will be treated as "infinite" and use all available data. If the
depth mode is used, then a depth level of 0 will instead produce the same result as a depth level of 1.

member.event: Fires when this property changes. The following state flag may be affected:
member.exception: The supplied value is less than 0.

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.Trevista.CogTrevistaDepthImageParams.DepthMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the algorithm used to compute the depth image.
member.value:
The algorithm used to calculate the depth image:
Default is .

remarks.para: The comes in two varieties: "local" and "global".
When the is , the is computed by effectively integrating the twice to get the surface height. Use Local mode to compute the relative heights of surface areas that lie near each other in your image.

When the is , the is computed by effectively integrating the and the to get the surface height. Use Global mode to compute the relative heights of surface areas that lie far away from each other in your image.

Flat areas of your 3D surface will have a value of zero in the floating point ContourImage, but may have a non-zero floating point value in the ShapeHorizontal and ShapeVertical images. This means that Global mode is a better choice for surfaces that have large, flat areas that are not perpendicular to the optical axis of your lens.

member.event: Fires when this property changes. The following state flag may be affected:
member.exception:
The supplied value is not a valid member of the
enumeration.

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.Trevista.CogTrevistaCommonImageParams.WhiteLevel
member.summary: Gets or sets the floating point pixel value that will be mapped to white in VisionPro output images.
member.value: Default value is 1.

remarks.para:
When the CogTrevista
function runs, the computed pixel values are initially stored as floating point numbers.

These internal floating point values fall into one of two ranges:
Positive only: No values are less than zero. The values are usually less than one, but can be greater than one in exceptional cases.
Negative and positive: The values are usually in the range between negative one and positive one, but they can be outside of this range in exceptional cases.

The internal floating point values are mapped to integer pixel values in VisionPro output images. The floating point value specified by
is mapped to black: an integer output pixel value of zero.

Similarly, the floating point value specified by
is mapped to white: the maximum pixel value for the specified output image depth. The integer value will be 255 for a and 65535 for a .

Any internal pixel value that falls between these two limits is linearly mapped to an intermediate shade of grey: a value between black and white. Floating point values that fall outside of the limits are mapped to either black or white, as specified by whichever limit is closer.
This property only supports float value type precision. Up to five decimal places (such as 0.00001) will be maintained. Further precision can be assigned but will be lost due truncation.

member.event: Fires when this property changes. The following state flag may be affected:

member.name: P:Cognex.VisionPro.Trevista.CogTrevistaCommonImageParams.BlackLevel
member.summary: Gets or sets the floating point pixel value that will be mapped to black in VisionPro output images.
member.value: Default value is 0.

remarks.para:
When the CogTrevista
function runs, the computed pixel values are initially stored as floating point numbers.

These internal floating point values fall into one of two ranges:
Positive only: No values are less than zero. The values are usually less than one, but can be greater than one in exceptional cases.
Negative and positive: The values are usually in the range between negative one and positive one, but they can be outside of this range in exceptional cases.

The internal floating point values are mapped to integer pixel values in VisionPro output images. The floating point value specified by
is mapped to black: an integer output pixel value of zero.

Similarly, the floating point value specified by
is mapped to white: the maximum pixel value for the specified output image depth. The integer value will be 255 for a and 65535 for a .

Any internal pixel value that falls between these two limits is linearly mapped to an intermediate shade of grey: a value between black and white. Floating point values that fall outside of the limits are mapped to either black or white, as specified by whichever limit is closer.
This property only supports float value type precision. Up to five decimal places (such as 0.00001) will be maintained. Further precision can be assigned but will be lost due truncation.

member.event: Fires when this property changes. The following state flag may be affected:

member.name: T:Cognex.VisionPro.Trevista.CogTrevistaMotionTypeConstants
member.summary: This enumeration is used to specify how the processing of output images will compensate for relative motion that occurred between acquisition of each of the four input shading images.
member.remarks:
Motion compensation is only relevant for
images. It has no effect, and no reasonable interpretation, for
images.

member.name: F:Cognex.VisionPro.Trevista.CogTrevistaMotionTypeConstants.Linear
member.summary: Linear motion compensation will be included.

member.name: F:Cognex.VisionPro.Trevista.CogTrevistaMotionTypeConstants.None
member.summary: No motion compensation will be performed.

member.name: T:Cognex.VisionPro.Trevista.CogTrevistaProcessorTypeConstants
member.summary: This enumeration is used to specify the preferred mechanism for the processing of results.

member.name: F:Cognex.VisionPro.Trevista.CogTrevistaProcessorTypeConstants.GpuIfAvailable
member.summary: Compute results using a supported GPU if available, otherwise use a CPU.

member.name: F:Cognex.VisionPro.Trevista.CogTrevistaProcessorTypeConstants.CpuOnly
member.summary: Always compute results using a CPU.

member.summary: This enumeration is used to specify the desired image type for a specific output image.

member.summary: The output image should be of type .

member.name: F:Cognex.VisionPro.Trevista.CogTrevistaImageTypeConstants.UInt8
member.summary: The output image should be of type .

member.summary: This enumeration is used to specify the algorithm used to compute the .

member.name: F:Cognex.VisionPro.Trevista.CogTrevistaDepthModeConstants.Global
member.summary: When the is Global, the is computed by effectively integrating the and the to get the surface height.

member.name: F:Cognex.VisionPro.Trevista.CogTrevistaDepthModeConstants.Local
member.summary:
When the
is Local, the is computed by effectively integrating the twice to get the surface height.
